post_title: It shouldn't be so hard to find...
post_text:
I kinda know this ad doesn't belong here, but it doesn't seem to belong anywhere. So I'll just write what I think and see what happens.
I'm a single guy in my late thirties. I'm a clean, drug free, well rounded individual. I'd like to find someone to spend some of my free time with. Dinner here. A movie there. More intimate time as well. But ultimately it is about finding someone I get along with. To find that person, you have to put yourself out there and search. So...here I am.
The problem is that it seems like most of the people on CraigsList are wrapped up in purely the physical. Men and women alike. Maybe it isn't just Craigslist. After all, hotornot and tinder are popular for a reason. But c'mon. Do you *truly* expect to find a Brad Pitt lookalike on CL? And if you did, wouldn't you wonder what is wrong with him that he's resorting to CL? Have fun with those herpes. I guess I expect some of that attitude in the "casual encounters" section, because let's be honest, that is mostly physical. But even then, it seems expectations are unreasonable, and while I browse those ads and have posted there from time to time, ultimately I want more of a connection than that.
But the other sections seem to be equally odd in their own way. College kids who think their odds will be better in another section. Or women who will post that they are a BBW, but then expect a Ken (as in Ken and Barbie), or are severely broken in more psychological ways. It is a jungle out there.
Anyways, this isn't supposed to be a rant. I guess I'm hoping there are a few women out there that will read this ad and be able to associate. From what little I've seen, there are a lot of broken guys on CL too, and a ton of creepy ads. And a fair number of dick pics. Weird. So maybe a woman will read this and realize it isn't a rant, but will say "hey, he gets it" and they've had their struggles finding someone too. So ...who's up for just meeting a regular guy. Not to jump into getting married. Not to jump into getting in bed. But to y'know, enjoy the moments, engage in the mental and physical, and let the rest figure itself out? 
Surprise me?
